page.title: 01LOCATION
page.content: Our area consists of a small valley and its surrounding hillsides in the Pennine hills. The valley is occupied by the River Don, a railway (now disused) and a main road linking Barnsley with Manchester and parts of Cheshire. The river rises a few miles away to the west on the moors above Winscar reservoir, near Dunford Bridge, and then flows East. It flows through Doncaster, to which it gives its name, and eventually joins the River Humber. In the narrow valley are the township of Thurlstone, and westwards, the village of Millhouse Green. They are situated just outside the small market town of Penistone. Both settlements come within the Barnsley council area. Although Barnsley is only 9 miles away, and Sheffield 13 miles, this area is rural and of great beauty and historic
